# Cambridge International AS & A Level

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
May/June 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 383, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 487, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 558, 484, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 573, 885, 603]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 860, 634]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 666, 217, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 682, 388, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 84, 616, 306]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 330, 920, 381]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = 4^{2x - a}\), where \(a\) is an integer. As shown in the diagram, the graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x\) is a straight line passing through the point (0, \(-20.8\)), where the second coordinate is given correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 393, 146, 411]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 393, 556, 411]]<|/det|>
Show that the gradient of the straight line is ln 16.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 393, 920, 411]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 668, 146, 686]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 668, 364, 686]]<|/det|>
Determine the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 668, 920, 686]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 744, 92]]<|/det|>
Express the equation \(7\tan \theta +4\cot \theta -13\sec \theta = 0\) in terms of \(\sin \theta\) only.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 510, 751, 529]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(7\tan \theta +4\cot \theta -13\sec \theta = 0\) for \(0^{\circ}< \theta < 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[336, 83, 698, 266]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 285, 920, 320]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = 3 \sin x - 3 \sin 2x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \pi\). The curve meets the \(x\)-axis at the origin and at the points with \(x\)-coordinates \(a\) and \(\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 333, 148, 351]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 333, 364, 351]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 333, 920, 351]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 606, 144, 625]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 606, 437, 625]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 606, 920, 625]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 415, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(x^{2}y + 2y^{3} = 48.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point (4, 2), giving your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 376, 92]]<|/det|>
By sketching the graphs of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[359, 98, 638, 119]]<|/det|>
\[y = |5 - 2x| \qquad \text{and} \qquad y = 3\ln x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 125, 821, 144]]<|/det|>
on the same diagram, show that the equation \(|5 - 2x| = 3\ln x\) has exactly two roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 125, 920, 144]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 667, 146, 686]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 667, 767, 686]]<|/det|>
Show that the value of the larger root satisfies the equation \(x = 2.5 + 1.5\ln x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 667, 920, 686]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 774, 92]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that the value of the larger root lies between 4.5 and 5.0.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 510, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part **(b)**, to find the value of the larger root correct to 3 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 5 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 528, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 410, 103]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{9\mathrm{e}^{2x} + 16}{\mathrm{e}^x - 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 115, 146, 133]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 114, 831, 134]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of any stationary point on the curve satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 140, 598, 160]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{e}^{x}(3\mathrm{e}^{x} - 8)(3\mathrm{e}^{x} + 2) = 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 141, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
